title: Need Advice: Wayfair vs JumpCloud Offer Comparison
content:
Hey folks, I need some advice on choosing between two offers:

Option 1: Wayfair
💰 CTC: 32 LPA + 1.9 LPA PF
🛠 Tech Stack: Java
🏢 Office: 3 days a week (fixed)

Option 2: JumpCloud
💰 CTC: 35 LPA + 1.7 LPA PF + ESOPs(6250units over 4 years)
🛠 Tech Stack: Go
🏢 Office: Fully Remote

My Thoughts:
Wayfair seems to be lowballing me, given my market expectations.
JumpCloud competes with Okta and is growing rapidly, which seems like an exciting opportunity.
I have more experience with Java, but I am open to learning Go if needed. Go demand is also growing
Work-life balance and flexibility are important to me.
Would love to hear your thoughts! Which one would you pick and why? Any red flags or things I should consider before making a decision?

Have asked wayfair match other offer

Thanks in advance! 🙌

title: Visa Inc | SWE - 1 | Bangalore | Mar 2025
content:
Education - B.Tech in CSE
YOE - 1.5+
Current company - Logistics med-size startup
Current comp - 14.7 LPA (13.6 Fixed + 1.1 Bonus)
Profile: SDE - 1
Mode: Remote

Company: Visa Inc
Profile: SWE - 1
Location: Bangalore
CTC: 20 LPA (17 Fixed + 1 PF + 0.4 Gratuity + 1.7 Bonus)
Stocks: 18K USD (20-20-60)

I might be promoted to SDE-II by the end of March. I tried to negotiate, but this is the best they can offer.
A few reasons for the switch:
* Interested in working on a large-scale system.
* Missing good engineering practices like code reviews, automation testing, etc., because I am the only developer who is working on the current system.
* Not focusing on tech debt, which I am pretty sure will backfire in the future.

Pros which I feel (Current org):
* Flexible timing
* No tight deadlines
* Working remotely

What are your thoughts about the offer?

title: Walmart | Software Engineer 3 | Bengaluru
content:
**Education**: B.Tech in CS from an old NIT
**Years of Experience**: 2.5
**Prior Experience**: SDE 2 at an Investment Bank
**Compensation**: 21.8 LPA (21L fixed, rest variable)

```
Company: Walmart
Title/Level: Software Engineer 3 (IN3)
Location: Bengaluru, India
Salary: ₹24,50,000 (including retirals)
Stock Bonus: 25% of salary every year, vested equally over 3 years
Bonus: 20% of salary
Joining Bonus: ₹2L
Total Compensation: ~₹37L
First-Year Compensation: ~₹33L
```
Tried negotiating the fixed pay, but HR refused, stating that the bonus payout is usually over 100% every year, which I  confirmed from others as well. Accepted the offer as there was a decent increase in total compensation, and I wanted to move out of the banking sector.

Interview experience: https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6492160/Walmart-or-Software-Engineer-3-or-Bengaluru-or-Offer

title: Walmart SEIII | Zeta SDE2 | Banglore
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier1 college
Years of Experience: 2 year, 10 months (Currently working as an SDE2 at Unicorn startup)
Date of the Offer: March 2025


**Company: Walmart**
Title/Level: Software Engineer III (Equivalent to SDE2)
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: INR 23.6 LPA (Base + EPF)
Signing Bonus: INR 3.5 LPA
Stock bonus: INR 6 LPA **RSUs** vested over 3 years devided equally = INR 2LPA for 1st year
Bonus: Performance-based upto INR 4.5LPA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):  **INR 33.6 LPA**
Benefits: 30 paid vacation days + 25K fitness reimbursement yearly + 20k for medicines + cab services + Health Insurence + few other benifits
 
Other details: Hybrid work (3days office + 2 days WFH). Compensation negotiated once, original offer did not have signing bonus. 

I have accepted this offer and Joining date is one week later from now.




**Company: Zeta (Directi)**
Title/Level: SDE2
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: INR 32 LPA (Base + EPF)
Signing Bonus: INR 2 LPA
Stock bonus: INR 8 LPA **ESOPs**  vested over 4 years devided 10%, 20%, 30%, 40% = INR 80K for 1st year
Bonus: Performance-based upto INR 1LPA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock):  **INR 35.8 LPA**
Benefits: 30 paid vacation days + Health Insurence  

Other details: 5 day work from Office. Office is 12km away so I will have to shift/relocate.
Note : Compensation under negotiation, expecting to finalize in 1-2 days



**Which one should I choose ??**

Walmart seems good to me in terms of name and benifits and considering I won't have to relocate but they are offering very less salary (specially the base component)

Should I try to negotiate this with walmart? How much should I ask and what are the chances they will consider it??

Considering 1st year component only, Although zeta is offering much better base, their over all compensation is almost equal to the walmart and Negative point is its 5 day work from office and I will have to relocate as well from my current location.

Under what condition should I consider Zeta over walmart?? How much more zeta should offer so that it can be accepted.

title: Urgent Help : Regarding Amazon Interview for Data Engineer
content:
Hi community,


I have my first-round interview scheduled with Amazon for the Data Engineer 1 role. The HR has mentioned the following topics in the invitation:


Coding: Basic scripting using Python, Scala, Java, etc. (any one)
Structured Query Language (SQL)
Leadership Principles: Learn and Be Curious, Dive Deep
I need some urgent guidance on the following:


To what extent should I prepare for DSA and SQL? Will it be medium-hard Leetcode-style questions, or should I expect something different?

Do I need to be prepared for questions related to my projects and past experience?

title: Offer evaluation
content:
Hi, I am having offer from two orgs:
Before that, my CCTC is 18 LPA, 4.5 YOE. Salary increment cycle will happen in June, expecting atmost 10% increase.

IBM ISDL - Band 7a - 24 Fixed and 1.7 (pf + gratutity) + 2L Joining bonus (1L after 1 month, 1L after 12 months) + some variable in terms of GDP and PA (maximum would be 10% of Fixed)
Hilabs - Senior Data Engineer - 23 Fixed, 1L joining, upto 4.6L of Perf bonus and some 1000 stocks (around 6L for 4 years)
The work in IBM is very central to IBM cloud where I will work with Staff Engineers, and on Hilabs work is around Product for health insurance companies in US. Inclination towards IBM, how much can I negotiate further with them.

content:
Education: B.Tech 
Years of Experience: 4.8yrs

Current Job: Software Engineer III at MNC/ Tech giant 
Current Comp : 28.2L (24.5 fixed + perf bonus + PF)
Base: 24.5L
Yearly performance based bonus: 1.7L
RSUs (yearly): 2.2L
Benefits : standard mnc benefits. (internet, medical bill reimbursements etc)

Date of the Offer: Feb 2025
Company: Microsoft
Level: L61
Location: Hyderabad
Microsoft comp:
Base: 31L (Includex fixed pay + company's PF contribution) 
Performance-based bonus: 0-20%; avg 10%
Stock bonus: $70K vested over 4 years (approx 15.25 lpa)
Signing Bonus: 7L (5+2)
Relocation bonus: 6.2L


Interview rounds :
R1: DSA
R2: DSA
R3: DSA + System Design (15-20 min)
R4: Senior manager - culture fit + system design discussion


Other details: Asked for L62, recruiter said that team has provided feedback for L61 only. No change in that.

==============

Other offer : 
1. Comp:  44.5 LPA (40 LPA fixed + 2.5 PF + upto 2.5 performance bonus) + ESOP (company not yet listed)
Relatively newer company,  US based , recently established in India.



==============

Need help with following points:

Level: I was expecting L62 given my experience, current desigation, and interview rounds performance, but I am being offered L61. I don't feel this transition from SE III to SE II/ L61 is fair enough. Should I consider L61?

Salary: In terms of fixed pay, it is just 4 Lakh increase from my current (~25lpa) to microsoft offer (29.2LPA , after PF cut) . No much progress i feel as I look to a good hike on base and especially confused when I have a standing offer of 40 LPA as fixed pay. 

Work culture: Microsoft no doubt has top notch employee benefits and culture. The other company on hand is relatively new, i'm afraid they might not have a roadmap and i'm afraid i might just be stuck there. 

What do you guys think and your suggestions on these points?

title: Capco | Java Backend Developer | Bangalore
content:
Got the salary breakup from the HR, once I accept the breakup the HR would roll out the offer.

**I was not working from Aug 2023 and started interviewing from September 2024.**

I know the salary numbers are not great, but right now I want to just start again. Plan is to upskill and aim high in one and half year, ideally for Staff Engineer role.

* Education: B.Tech in Computer Science
* Years of Experience: 7 years
* Prior Experience: Around 7 years in Software development
* Date of the Offer: 26 Feb 2025
* Company: Capco
* Title/Level: Java Backend Developer (Usually they have Technical Consultant role, need to confirm with the HR)
* Location: Bangalore
* Relocation: HR told me that there is some assistence, need to confirm the numbers.
* Joining Bonus: 300,000 INR

**Salary Breakup :
TCTC 3,800,000
Gross Pay 3,560,586**

**Components:-**
```
Monthly (in Rs.) Annual (in Rs.)
Basic 118,686  1,424,234

Gross Pay 296,716  3,560,586
```

```
Employer PF Contribution  14,242  170,908
Gratuity  5,709   68,506
TCTC 316,667  3,800,000
```

**What can I ask/negotiate with the HR to improve the compensation.**

title: Microsoft L61 Compensation Review
content:
I have got a verbal offer from Microsoft for Software Engineer 2 position for L61.

Experience - 5.5 years
Current Compensation - 25 lpa (fixed) + 2.5 lakh (benefits) + $11k rsu (4 years vesting) 
Product based MNC
Joining bonus - 2.5 lakh + relocation 5 lakh

Offered compensation details:
Base - 32 lpa
Stocks - 60-70k

title: Nvidia | IC4 | Bangalore
content:
Education: B tech from tier-2 college
    Years of Experience: little less than 9 years
    Prior Experience: Senior engineer in reputed product based MNC

    Date of the Offer:  February 2025
    Company:      Nvidia
    Title/Level:  IC-4
    Location:     Bangalore
    Base salary: 49
    Signing Bonus: 0
    Stock bonus: 82 lakhs over 4 years
    Bonus: No Bonus
    Vesting schedule : 40 - 30 - 20 - 10
    Total comp:
     First Year:      81.8 lakhs
	 Second Year:     73.6 lakhs
	 Third Year:      65.4 lakhs
	 Fourth Year:     57.2 lakhs

Nvidia has recently changed the vesting schedule to be 40-30-20-10 and due to this they have reduced the overall RSU component in new offers.

They are not negotiating at all these days and sticking to their offers.

This offer is not comparable to other FAANG companines at all, so people interviewing or targeting NVIDIA, I would suggest to get your expectation discussed with recruiter upfront.

I engaged with them about a month for going through all interviews - 6 rounds.

Worst part is even after clearing all rounds their recruiter does not even disclose/discuss numbers verbally, Another 2 week for the recruiter to get the offer released and ended up rejecting this since I already had a better offer.

[Interview Experience](https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6472641/Nvidia-or-Senior-software-Engineer-(IC4)-or-2025-or-Offer)

title: DocuSign | Software Engineer(P2) | Bangalore, India
content:
**Education**
* Education: Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA - non engineering degree)
* Education Institute: Tier-N College
* Graduation Year: 2022

**Prior Experience**
* Years of Experience: 2.8
* Organization: Service Based Organization(Mid Scale)
* Compensation: INR 7,25,000 (Fixed + Variable)

**Offer**
* Date of the Offer: February 2025
* Company: DocuSign
* Title/Level: Software Engineer(P2)
* Location: Bangalore, India
* Work Mode: Hybrid
* Base: INR 29,00,000
* Variable Bonus: 5% (INR 1,45,000)
* Relocation: Nil
* Signing Bonus: Nil
* Stock(RSUs): $65K stock grant vested equally over 4 years
* Total compensation for the 1st year (Base + Bonus + Stocks): ~around INR 44,50,000
* Benefits: Standard DocuSign Benefits + $500 for one time WFH setup

**Overview**
Jumping from 7.25 LPA to 44.5 LPA seems very strange right???..... But for me it took 2 years of consistent hardwork & yup a lot of sacrifices. Here's the glimpse of the hardwork: grinding leetcode, regular participation(and upsolving) in the contests on Leetcode, learning system design, missing office parties, missing friends meetups, applying to jobs on various portals like a mad and offcourse facing a hell lot of rejections.
But things that kept me moving were continuous Faith in the God & the statement that **It can't happen in ONE DAY, But it will surely happen ONE DAY**.


**Offer Action**
I've accepted the offer & have joined DocuSign as a Software Engineer.

title: Frontend Interview Prep: Machine Coding & System Design for Top Companies
content:
**This is the second time I am asking this question on LeetCode, as I did not receive any replies the first time. I believe this will be helpful not just for me but also for the community.**

I am currently working as an **SDE-2** as a Frontend Developer at an MNC with a base pay of 13.1L. I graduated in 2022 from a Tier-2 college (BMSCE). I want to deepen my frontend knowledge and transition into a top product-based company.

I understand that frontend interviews for such companies involve:
	1. Data Structures & Algorithms
	2. Machine Coding (Frontend System Design & Implementation)
	3. Frontend System Design (Scalability, Architecture, Performance, etc

**Questions:**
	1. What should be my structured roadmap for preparation?
	2. Which resources (blogs, courses, mock platforms) should I follow for E2E interview prep?
	3. How can I practice for the **Machine Coding round for UI-based problems**?
	4. What are some courses on **Frontend System Design** that I should follow to prepare for interviews at top companies?
	5. Any tips for excelling in the behavioral & hiring manager rounds?

I would really appreciate detailed guidance from experienced folks, as I believe this will also help others in the community. 
	-**Thanks in advance!**

title: Microsoft | L61 | Offer Declined
content:
**Offer Details:**  

- **Years of Experience:** 6.5 years  
- **Interview Date:** February 13, 2025  
- **Offer Date:** February 21, 2025  
- **Company:** Microsoft  
- **Title/Level:** L61  
- **Location:** Noida  
- **Base Salary:** INR 33,00,000  
- **Relocation Assistance:** None (already residing in NCR)  
- **Signing Bonus:** INR 13,00,000 (7+6)  
- **Stock Bonus:** $100K stock grant vested over 4 years  
- **Performance Bonus:** Up to 20% of base salary annually  
- **Total Compensation (First Year):** ~60 LPA (Salary + Bonus + Stock)  
- **Benefits:** Standard Microsoft benefits  
- **Negotiation Outcome:** Initially offered $60K in stocks and a signing bonus of 5+5; after negotiation, the signing bonus increased, but the base salary remained unchanged.  

**Current Compensation:**  

- **Company:** MNC in Gurgaon  
- **Base Salary:** 40 LPA  
- **Stock Grants:** $42,000  

**Additional Notes:**  

1. The recruiter initially reached out for an L62 role. Though not actively seeking a job change, I decided to proceed with the interview.  
2. All interviews were conducted on the same day, and the offer was extended a week later.  
3. My first round didn't go well (likely why I was offered L61 instead of L62), but the rest of the interviews went well.  
4. I requested for additional interviews for L62, but the recruiter declined.  
5. The recruiter stated that 33 LPA base salary and a 13 LPA signing bonus were the highest possible for L61.  
6. The recruiter was uncooperative and barely allowed me to speak.

title: UBS Compensation | 2023 | On Campus Placement
content:
Interview Experience https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/4175260/UBS-On-Campus-Interview-Experience-2023-Batch

CTC: INR 12,50,000
Relocation: INR 2,00,000
Bonus: At the end of Financial year on top of CTC (~50K).
ESOPs: None by default. For every 3 bought 1 is awarded (You need to buy).
Total: INR ~15,00,000

Leaves: 15 sick + 23 vacation + 15 casual (on need basis). Volunteering days ~2 off.

Standard Benefits: Subsidized meal, free transport, annual health checkups, medical OPD reimbursement (upto ~15K), Practo subscription, headspace app subscription, insurance, etc.

Saying this is max they can offer for MTS

Title/Level: SMTS
Location: Bangalore
Salary: 38,00,000
Stock bonus: $39,000 (~34L for 4 years, 13.6L 1st year) : vesting @[40% , 30% , 20% , 10% ]

38L (Base) + 13.6L (RSU) 

Benefits:  https://www.oracle.com/careers/culture/benefits/


**Flipkart**

Location: Bangalore

Relocation Bonus - 1.5L

**Kotak**

Location: Bangalore
Salary: 49,00,000
Joining Bonus - 3L

Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): **52L (1st year)**
49L (Base) + 3L

**Guys need your opnion**
Have been struggling for job switch from past 6 months . 
Will update a detailed journey of past 6 months once this is sorted .

title: Offer Evaluation | JPMC AWM SE 3 vs Target marketplace L5 | Current Walmart
content:
Current Company : Walmart
**Total YOE - 6 Years** ( Walmart - 2.5, Amdocs - 1.5 , TCS - 2 years)
Current compensation: 25 base + 5 variable + 6 stocks for 3 years

**JPMC offer : 51 L**
Base: 45 , Joining bonus - 6
**Project Tech stack** : Legacy banking applications and supports for those apps + building java spring boot apps to decomission the older ones.
Working Model - 3 days a week but will become 5 days eventually within 3 to 4 months


**Target offer:**
Base : 42
Variable: 10 % of base: 4.2
Stocks : - No
Joining bonus : No
**Team: Target Marketplace**
**Project and Tech stack:** Kotlin and Reactive Programming , Marketplace apps revamping (Legacy apps with Java spring boot has to be revamped with Micronaut framework and Functional Kotlin.
Working Model - 2 days a week in office 
Benefits - Standard Target benefits like free food, CAB, Gym membership

Please let me know your thoughts on this. Whether to go ahead with Target or JPMC based on **growth**, **WLB** and good learning and latest **tech stack**.

**Update:** --> Before interviewing at Target, please confirm about the expectations. They will deny after the completion of all rounds.

title: PhonePe | SDE-1 | Offer
content:
Education: Tier - 1 (old IIT circuital)
Years of Experience: 7 months at a fintech MNC
Date of the Offer: Feb 2025
Company: PhonePe
Title/Level: Software Engineer (PhonePe has flat hierarchy)
Location: Bangalore (5 days WFO)
Salary: 19.25L
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 3L
Stock bonus: ESOPS: 8.5L vested over 4 years
Bonus: None
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 22.25L + ESOPS 
Benefits: Standard PhonePe Benefits
Other details: Tried to negotiate but the recruiter won't budge.

I feel like this offer is a low-ball given that they already offer 5L joining bonus on-campus. Negotiation can work only if I have a counter-offer which I don't currently have. I'm trying to get another offer in the meanwhile. Is there anything else that the community recommends?

UPDATE:

Negotiated with the recruiter with an expecting offer (didn't have one though). I sensed their desperatiion to close the position and stood my ground with the negotiation. So to make sure that I don't ditch them later with some other offer, they increased the numbers:

Salary: 20L (Matched the base)
Signing Bonus: 5L
Stock Bonus: 8.5 L over 4 years
TC: 25L + ESOPS (1st year)
Verdict: Accepted

title: AWS vs Google | Entry Level SDE 1 & L3 | Bay Area vs Durham, NC
content:
I was an intern at AWS for 2 years, got an offer for Amazon and Google here is TC comparison, opinions?
Amazon team seems like it would be more stressful, has oncall rotation, the people on the team weren't very like outgoing, but probably faster promotion timeline because I was an intern for 2 years. Google team seems like less stress, similar work, no oncall, team was very friendly and welcoming. Picture below

title: Contract vs Permanent
content:
Hi Guys! please help me in choosing the right opportunity:
Total YOE : 10 years

1) Contract job : will have to work for late hours 3PM to 12PM IST for a FAANG company 
							Salary : 3L per month (fixed with no tax and no PF/Insurance/Gratuity etc and no job security) 
							Will be working for USA team remotely on a very new project so timings need to overlap with them.
	
2) Permanent Job : WFH but might have to go 2-3 times a month. Not a FAANG but a product company. 
							   Salary : 50L/annual ( basic ) + 3L Joining Bonus + 5% Variable on basic salary.
							   Decent WLB and average work but better job security with easy 9-5 life.
							   
I am confused between comfortable and secure job vs competitive work environment.

title: Oracle (OHAI) vs Verve group. Please help !!
content:
Hello Leetcoders, Please help me in choosing the best offer. My priority is future growth with good learning opportunities.

YOE: 2.5 years
Tech stack : Java, Spring boot, Azure
Current org: Aviation PBC
Current CTC: 14.5 (base) + 1 (bonus)

I am currently holding 2 offers:

**Oracle (OHAI):**

Title/Level: IC2
Tech stack : Java
Salary: 22.6 LPA (PF included)
Stock Bonus: None
TC : 22.6 L

**Verve group:**

Title/Level: SDE-2
Tech stack : Golang (primary) + Java
Salary: 28 LPA (PF included)
RSU : Company will match 20% of the employee’s committed contribution to purchase shares.
Other benefits : 50k per year (Travel, fitness, shopping etc). Potential onsite chance after 2 years.
TC : 28.5 L

While I feel Oracle is a safe bet, I'm also looking for good learning opportunity. Verve is a Germany based company which is into ad tech domain & a good scale is involved. They are setting up the team in Bangalore. Only downside is it has got bad glassdoor ratings (3.2/5).

Do you guys think I can negotiate with Oracle (I've already accepted the offer)? Will brand and tech stack matter for my future switch? These are my primary concerns. Requesting you to help me out.

Thanks

title: Uber | L5-A | Bangalore
content:
Giving back to the leetcode community.
I appeared for the Hiring Drive in Feb 2025. 

**1st Round - DS/Algo** (Working solution was expected)
There was a dependency graph given for tasks based on execution. I had to print out right order of execution of tasks for a given task.  

**2nd Round - DS/Algo** (Working solution was expected)
Modified number of island problem

**3rd Round - LLD** (Working solution was expected)
Design a task scheduling system. Task should have some executable which should be run when it is excuted.

**4th Round - HLD** 
Get nearest restaurants for a customer. 
The interviewer focused **only** on how to store the restaturant data in DB and get the nearest restaurants for a customer. The emphasis was on DB schema and APIs. 
Further questions - 
1. What will happen if there are hot spots
2. What will happen if there are no nearby restaurants.
I designed the system using cassandra with co-rodinate hash as partitioning and clustering key.
No discussion on scale happened. I had to specifically talk about scale and fail safes.

**5th Round - HM** 
Typical manegerial questions- 30 mins
Complicated design problem which I solved - 30 mins

title: Google L3 Chances | Interview Experience
content:
Hi , I recently interviewed for an L3 position at Google and would like to get feedback from fellow Googlers regarding my interview experience.

Note:- All the ratings(SH/LH/H) I mentioned below are from my experience only, not from recruiter.

Current Experience:- 1.6 Yrs (Software Engineer at Service Based Company)

Applied:- Recruiter reached out to me.

Phone Screening:- SH ( I solve complete problem without any hint and solved follow ups as well)

After the phone screening, I received feedback from HR saying that it was positive, and they wanted to move forward with the onsite interviews.

Onsite Round 1:- SH ( I solved the problem without hints, initially i give PBDS approach for which he said if I use PBDS I have to implement its function as well otherwise i have to change approach, then i solve it using other DS with TC and code, no followups).

Onsite Round 2:- H/LH ( I got stuck midway. Unfortunately I missed a hint in the problem constraints, and interviewer said I was close. But, after the hint, I solved the problem completely, including the code and time complexity.)

Onsite Round 3:- H/LH (I explained my approach and code it as well, but stuck on Time Complexity, wasted some time, then give final TC and he was satisfied with it, then solve 1 followup with code and TC, but he said he have one more followup which he couldn't ask due to time constraints).

G&L Round:- SH/H (The interviewer asked me general HR Questions and was satisfied with my answers, I believe it should be a SH).


Can anyone with experience provide feedback on whether I should expects a call for the next steps?

title: Oracle VS Paypal (Need Help)
content:
Hi Folks,
I have joined Oracle 1 week ago, and after joining I have received another offer from Paypal.
Oracle's TC:
Base: 30.5
RSUs: 36K USD vested over 4 years (40-30-20-10)

Second Year: 39.5 LPA

Any suggestion would be greatly appreciated.

title: Amazon | SDE-1 | Bangalore
content:
Amazon SDE I Offer Details:
Education: B.Tech (I.T.) from Tier 3 College ( 2023 batch)
Years of Experience: 1.5 year experience at one of Big 4 company but not in full-stack or SDE
Current Compensation: ~6.5LPA

Date of the Offer: Feb/2025
Company: Amazon
Title/Level: Software Development Engineer I (SDE I)
Location: Bangalore, India


Compensation
Base Salary: ₹19,17,000 per year

Signing Bonus:
Year 1: ₹6,47,000
Year 2: ₹5,18,000
Stock Bonus (RSUs): ₹15,56,000 vested over 4 years
Total Compensation (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~₹25.5L (Year 1)  and  ~₹24.5L (Year 2)
Benefits
Leave Policy:
15 working days of annual leave per financial year.
12 calendar days of sick leave per financial year.
12 calendar days of casual leave per financial year.
10 mandatory and optional holidays per calendar year.
Transportation Allowance:
₹4,000 per month for employees in Tier 1 cities (Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai, Mumbai, NCR, Kolkata).
₹1,500 per month for other cities.

No other offer in-hand.

Accepted the Offer as I am getting a Good Hike and better role as SDE in such a big company.

Although accepted but a bit nervous! Any Advice?

Interview Experience - https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6425074/Amazon-SDE-1-or-Bangalore-or-Amazon-university-talent-acquisition

title: Salesforce SMTS Offer
content:
Education: M.Tech from Tier I
Experience: 8+ years
Previous Role: SSE at a product-based company (non-FAANG)
Previous Compensation:
	Base Salary: 51 LPA
	Stock Bonus: 60K USD (vested over 4 years equally)
	Bonus: 15% of base
	Total Comp: ~71.4 LPA
New Offer (Salesforce)
	Company: Salesforce
	Title/Level: SMTS
	Location: Hyderabad
	Base Salary: 52 LPA
	Joining Bonus: 5 L
	Relocation Bonus: 2.5 L
	Stock Bonus: 74K USD (vested over 4 years equally)
	Bonus: 15% of base
	Total First-Year Compensation: 80.5 LPA (Base + Bonus + Stock + JB)
	Benefits: Standard Salesforce perks

Concern:
Primarily switching to move to Hyderabad and mentioned this during the verbal offer call, though the recruiter never asked about it in previous stages. Feeling lowballed—did mentioning this as my reason for switching hurt my negotiation?

No competing offers, just started interviewing.
Tried negotiating once, but the recruiter stood firm on the numbers.
Surprisingly, he asked "Why are you looking for a change?" during the verbal offer call.

Would appreciate any suggestions on how I could have handled this better or what my next steps should be.

title: Visa Inc | SW Engineer | 1.5 YOE | Suggestions needed
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier 3
Years of Experience: 1.5+
Current company: Product based 
Current Comp: 10 LPA (base) + Peanuts


Date of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: Visa
Title/Level: SW Engineer
Location: india
Base: 14 LPA
Total comp: 16 L + Peanuts with no stock option


Other details: This is my first offer, and I didn't have anything to negotiate. I've already resigned—my current company was willing to match, but I declined as I wanted a fresh start. Do you think I should try during my notice period?

Reason for looking out:
I wasn’t getting any real learning opportunities, and the project was a complete mess—no testing, no code reviews, no best practices, and barely any time for testers (just one day for manual testing before production). This created a toxic work culture where fixing one bug often led to discovering more, due to the lack of proper testing. As a result, meeting committed timelines became nearly impossible. On top of that, I had to deal with incompetent coworkers.  

Would love to hear your thoughts!

title: BNY SA or MasterCard SE2
content:
Hi fellow Leetcoders,


I need your help. I have around 3.7 years of experience and I have started from TCS with a CTC of 3.6 LPA.
I done a switch and secured an package of 14LPA + 1Lakh Bonus which is my current CTC.


Due to some reasons I had decided to look for openings again and I wanted to join an banking/finance related tech company. Luckily I was interviewing with BNY and Mastercard at the same time and I have got the offer from both the company but currently I'm not sure which company to join.


BNY
Is giving me a CTC of 22.5 Fixed and there would be an annual bonus based on performance (no fix amount)

Matercard
Is giving me a CTC of 22.6 Fixed and there would be a fixed annual bonus of 1.6 LPA

The bonus would be something which I will receive at the end of the financial year or in Feb 2026.

Your opinions/experience will help me decide which company would be a better match for me.

title: Amazon | SDE 1 Fresher | India
content:
## <b/> Amazon SDE I Offer Details:

**Education:** B.E in CS from Tier 3 College
**Years of Experience:** 7 Months Internship Experience at Startup 
**Date of the Offer:** Feb/2025
**Company:** Amazon  
**Title/Level:** Software Development Engineer I (SDE I)  
**Location:** Bangalore, India  

### **Compensation**
- **Base Salary:** ₹19,17,000 per year  
- **Relocation Bonus:** ₹1,50,000  
- **Signing Bonus:**  
  - Year 1: ₹6,47,000  
  - Year 2: ₹5,18,000  
- **Stock Bonus (RSUs):** ₹15,56,000 vested over 4 years  
- **Total Compensation (Salary + Bonus + Stock):** ~₹25L (Year 1) / ~₹24L (Year 2)  

### **Benefits**
- **Leave Policy:**  
  - 15 working days of annual leave per financial year.  
  - 12 calendar days of sick leave per financial year.  
  - 12 calendar days of casual leave per financial year.  
  - 10 mandatory and optional holidays per calendar year.  
- **Transportation Allowance:**  
  - ₹4,000 per month for employees in Tier 1 cities (Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai, Mumbai, NCR, Kolkata).  
  - ₹1,500 per month for other cities.  

* And Many More Amazon Benefits..

* Here is my interview experience - https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6361672/amazon-sde-1-fresher-india-interview-experience/2836938/2836992

title: Salesforce | SMTS | 9+ YOE
content:
Hi All,

I’m excited to share that I have received an offer from Salesforce for the Bangalore location. I wanted to post this to give back to the LeetCode community.

**Current CTC**: 48 LPA (37 base + RSUs)
**Current level**: L62, Microsoft
**Reason for leaving:** The work became quite hectic, with a lot of repetitive tasks.

**Offered Level**: SMTS
**Offered CTC**: ~80 LPA
**Base**: 55 Lakhs
**RSUs**: $75k for four years
**Target Bonus**: 8.25 Lakhs

**Note**: I know some may suggest that I should have aimed for a higher level (LMTS) and a higher salary. However, my priority right now is to spend more time with my family for at least the next two years, and I believe the SMTS level will give me the flexibility I need. I explicitly asked the recruiter for the SMTS role when she initially reached out about the LMTS position.

Will share interview experience soon.

Thanks for reading, and I hope this post helps others in the community!

title: Deliveroo || Delhivery || ScryAI || GeoServe
content:
I have cracked multiple offers from multiple companies , sharing some insights about my experience

Just a brief about me im a 2021 graduate did my btech from tier 2 college in Delhi . Started my prep from July 2024

**Offer 1**: Geoserve (Bangalore) , had 3 rounds 
* DSA (Medium level)
* Design (design architecture and database of an ecomm application catalogoue)
* Discussion with engineering Head (basic behaviour and situation based questions)


**Offer 2** : ScryAI (Gurgaon sector 48), 3 rounds
* Python Basics and advanced
* DSA and python basics (Stack based medium level question)
* HR and salary discussion

**Offer 3**: Delhlivery Gurgaon , 3 Rounds
* DSA and database basics (Coin change problem and SQL related questions)
* Low level Design Stack overflow
* Design Caching system , low level

**Offer 4:** Deliveroo Hyderabad, 4 Rounds
* Hacker Rank Test (15 MCQ)
* Take home assignment (Create a CRON String Parser)
* Live coding round add features to the cron string parser and explain the code
* Behavioural Round (Expect situation based questions)
* High level Design round :  Design a system to do a Giveaway of 6 million burgers in 10 mins, we need to ensure each users gets only 1 burger.

title: Walmart Global Tech IN 3 (SWE 3) vs MasterCard L8 (SDE 2)
content:
College: Tier 2
Current Company: US based Fintech MNC
Current Comp: 19.8 Fixed + 10% AIP + RSUs (~10 lacs)
YOE: 2.5


Walmart : IN3 (SWE 3)
Base: 25.15 LPA (including PF)
Perf Bonus: 20 % of base
RSU: 25% of Base (~6 lacs) (Vested in 3 years) (25% of base Granted Every Year)
Joining Bonus: 2 lacs
Reallocation Bonus: 0 (Company takes care of flight tickets, hotel stays and brokerage reimbursement)
Location: Bangalore (Hybrid)
Perks: Cab Service, Free Food, Fitness Reimbursements

1st Year comp (without Joining bonus and reallocation): 
25.15 (base) + 4.8 (perf bonus) + 2 (1st year RSU) = 31.95


MasterCard: L8 (SDE 2)
Base: 29.5 LPA
Perf Bonus: 10% of base
RSU: 0
Joining bonus: 2 lacs
Relocation: 2.5 lacs
Location: Pune (Hybrid)
Perks: In Office Gym, Pune itself being a more affordable city than bangalore :)

1st Year comp (without joining bonus and reallocation):
29.5 (base) + 2.95 (perf bonus) = 32.45

Please help me decide (considering I will work for atleast 2-3 years after joining)
P.S: What is the scene of growth, hikes and layoffs in them

Radhe Radhe!

title: Amazon vs ServiceNow as SDE-I
content:
Can you guys help me choose between what should I choose overall between Amazon and ServiceNow, I'm a fresher (2025 batch). :
Details -
Compensation breakdown :


Base Pay (INR) : 1,917,000
Sign-on Bonus Year 1 (INR) : 647,000
Sign-on Bonus Year 2 (INR) : 518,000
The sign-on bonus is paid in monthly installments for both years.
Relocation allowance (one-time) (INR) : 150,000
Restricted Stock Unit Value (RSU) (4 years) * (INR) : 1,556,000
The RSU vesting cycle is 5% after Year 1, 15% after Year 2; and thereafter, 20% every six months until fully vested.
Other benefits includes :
Home internet reimbursement for up to INR 1,250 per month.
Meal card of INR 1,100 per month.
Medical insurance cover of INR 5,00,000 (family floater) for you and your dependents (spouse and up to two children).
Accident insurance cover for up to a maximum of three times annual base pay.
Life insurance cover for up to a maximum of four times annual base pay.
Annual health check which helps identify potential issues related to daily nutrition, fitness, and lifestyle habits.
5 days work from office

ServiceNow:
Associate Software Engineer
Salary Components

 Per Annum(INR)

A. Basic Salary

640,000

B. Flexible Benefit Plan (FBP)

960,000

C. Base Salary

1,600,000

D. Target Bonus

160,000

E. Company Contribution to PF (12% of Basic)

76,800

F. Company Contribution to Gratuity (4.81% of Basic)

30,784

Gross Cost to Company (C+D+E+F)

1,867,584

G. Sign-On Bonus

600,000 

*2 on 2nd month payroll;

2L on 13th month payroll & 2L on 19th month payroll

H. Relocation Bonus
150,000 

I. Equity - Restricted Stock Units

20,000 USD
Work mode - hybrid (2 days wfo in a week) also better job stability here.

title: Oracle Cerner | PMTS | Banglore
content:
Education: BTech Computer Science
Years of Experience: 9
Prior Experience: SSE at Walmart Banglore
Current CTC - 41L Fixed + 8L Bonus (Variable) + 9L RSU (Vested over 4 years)
Date of the Offer: January 2025
Company: Oracle Cerner
Title/Level: Principle Member of Technical Staff
Location: banglore
Salary: INR 5600000
Relocation: 0
Signing Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: $75000 stock grant vested over 4 years (40%, 30%, 20% and 10%)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~INR 70 LPA Yearly (Including RSUs)
Other details: this is original offer, They did not do any negotiation.


**Interview Experience:**
had total 5 rounds
1. Screening round - 2 coding questions (LC medium) one of them was in a given array, find all the subarrays for a given sum
2. After ~20 days of screen round, i got a call to schedule next technical rounds. so 3 rounds were scheduled in a single day
3. Round 2 Round3 & Round 4
	4. All of the above round happenned in a single day
	5. All of the rounds, the interviewer asked LC medium coding questions and LLD coding questions like
		6. Design Hotel Management system
		7. Design Multi level Parking Lot
	8. Coding questions were mostly on Arrays, some of them what i remember are below:

* finding the subarray with maximum sum (In an array which has positivie and negative integers)
* in a sorted array return the majority element if any present

Last round was Hiring Manager round where we discussed about current tech stack, role etc, and some scenario based questions like how would you idenitfy the issue if there is some latency on your application APIs? how do you deploy your applications on production? what monitoring tool do you use for monitoring overall applicaiton performance etc.

title: Visa Inc | Software Engineer
content:
Education: B.Tech in ECE from a Tier 3 college

Prior Experience: Developer at a service-based company
Current Compensation: 8.45 LPA
Years of Experience: 2 years 7 months

Date of Offer: January 2025
Company: Visa Inc
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Bengaluru
Base Salary: ₹15,00,000
Relocation, Joining Bonus & Stocks: Not applicable
Variable Pay / Performance Bonus: ₹1,50,000
PF (Company Contribution): ₹90,000
Gratuity: ₹36,000
Total Compensation: ₹17,76,000
Benefits: Standard Visa benefits

I applied for the position in October 2024 through LinkedIn and received an assessment link the very next day. After two months, I was invited for an interview. The selection process consisted of two rounds: a technical interview and a hiring manager round. After another month of waiting, I finally received a call from HR confirming my selection.

PS: This is my first offer while switching jobs, so I didn’t have anything to leverage. The HR team remained firm on the base salary without any flexibility for an increase.

title: Google vs Uber (L4 SDE 2)
content:
YOE: 3.5
Company: Startup
Current Base: 48LPA
Current TC: ~68LPA
Very recently joined (~5 months)

**Google Offer L4**
Base: 35L (this is their max i guess)
Target bonus: 15% (~5.5L)
Stock: 120k USD (~25L per year, front loaded)
Total: ~65LPA (averaged, didn't consider front loading and refreshers)
Total with front loading: ~80LPA

**Uber Offer L4:**
Base: 44.5
Performance: 7
Stock: 50K USD (~44 LPA)
Total first year: 62.5LPA

There isn't much negotiation room left in the offer from google. May be a room with Uber.
My priorities:
1. Quality of work
2. WLB
3. Good for Resum
4. Compensation

Need urgent suggestions, I may have bias towards Google offer because worked hard for it.
Beside that bias, can you guys please help to give pointers to think upon or your suggestions which one should i join.


Thanks, learnt a lot from this community ! Will be sharing interview experience soon.

title: Help regarding Breakup of compensation
content:
Cash component of Salary includes 
* Basic Salary
* Flexible Components : It includes House Rent Allowance (HRA), Leave Travel Allowance (LTA), National Pension Scheme (NPS), Telephone Reimbursement etc.

So my question is Will monthly salary include 'Flexible Components' part completely? 
Is monthly salary = (Basic Salary + Flexible Components)/12 ?

title: Salesforce SMTS | Amazon SDE-2 | 5.5 years
content:
Education: BE from Tier 1
Years of Experience: 5.5
Prior Experience: E-Commerce Firm
Previous Compensation -> 27 Base + 3 Variable + 8 ESOP/year = 38 LPA


Company : Amazon
Date of the Offer: 15th November 2024
Title/Level: SDE-2
Location: Hyderabad
Base Salary: 44 LPA (Inc. PF)
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 16 L -> 1st Year, 14L -> 2nd year
Stock bonus: 238 units -> Divided in 4 years. [5%,15%,40%,40%]
Bonus: Relocation Bonus of 1.5L was given
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 44 + 16 + 2L ~ 62 LPA for 1st year
Benefits: Standard Amazon benefits -> Wifi, Medical Insurance, Cab, Food etc
Other details: 5 days WFO


Company : Salesforce
Date of the Offer: 15th December 2024
Title/Level: SMTS
Location: Bangalore
Base Salary: 54 LPA (Inc. PF)
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 1.5L
Stock bonus: 68K USD RSU -> Divided in 4 years.
Bonus: 15% of base salary -> 8.2L
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 54 + 8.2 + 17k USD (~14.6/year) ~ 76.6 LPA
Benefits: Standard Salesforce benefits -> 5K worth of reimbursement every year, Medical Insurance, Education Reimbursements, Free Food in Office etc.
Other details: Hybrid (~2 days every week)


I will write a comprehensive post for experiences and failures. For the last 6-8 months, I have been giving interviews with being rejected in more then 50+ companies.

PS - I have joined Salesforce
This is my post from 3 years back regarding rejections to offers. I will share my last 6 months experience soon. For all those struggling can read about my previous post also.


https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/1242231/rejections-to-multiple-offers-journey-experience-advice/

title: HFT | Staff | 9.5 YOE | India
content:
Education: Tier 2 (Btech - CSE)
Years of Experience: 9.5 YOE
Prior Experience: 3 Startups
Current Comp: 90(base) + ESOPS


Month of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: HFT (Cant disclose)
Title/Level: Staff Frontend
Location: Bengaluru
Fixed Salary: Rs 95 LPA
Signing Bonus: 10 lakhs
Perf Bonus: 20% - 30%
Total First year TC (Salary + Bonus + Joining):  1.25Cr ~ 1.35Cr

Personally it almost feels like a lateral move wrt pay as my fixed pay is almost the same, but I get actual money instead of paper money at the end of the year. I have also been approached by Google for L5 role, right after I have finished all my rounds in this company. But given this offer is almost close to L5 level and that the bonus component in HFTs can get really high for top performers after proving their skills, I have decided not to go ahead with the process. Not to mention the layoffs, politics for L6 promotion and huge waiting times for team matching at Google.

~~I also think I have reached the cliff when it comes to IC role comp and~~ I want to settle in a stable company without worrying about layoffs or funding issues (startups).

title: Samsara | Senior Software Engineer | Bangalore
content:
Education: B.Tech Tier-1 College
Years of Experience: 7.5 years
Prior Experience: Senior at one of the FAANG level companies
Date of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: Samsara
Title: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore
Salary/Base: ₹58,00,000 (including PF)
Annual Bonus: ~₹5,60,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: ₹1.23 cr vested equally over 3 years (33%, 33%, 34%)
Total Comp: Roughly 1.05cr

This was their initial offer, didnt negotiate as i planned to go ahead with another offer, but the way recruiter was talking, it seemed like they wouldnt move much. 

Note: They are setting up a new office in Bangalore, they are starting with a team of 30 SWEs but plan to scale to 200+ in the next couple of years. Their country head mentioned that Bangalore is planned to be their second biggest office after Seattle. Work seemed good.

I asked for a JB as well, they mentioned that Samsara doesnt give JBs yet but they have raised this with the Finance team and plan to soon add a JB component as well. So their pay should increase a little in the upcoming days. Seems like they are losing candidates because of not giving JB :)

title: Salesforce | SMTS | Offer
content:
Education: Tier 1 (IIT)
Years of Experience: 5.5 YOE (all in the same current company)
Position:- SWE in a product company (can't disclose the name right now, sorry)
Current : 41L (Base) + 8L (Bonus) + 35L (RSUs per year) = 84LPA (a lot of it is due to the stock appreciation)
Location: Hyderabad

Date of the Offer: Jan 2025
Title/Level: SMTS
Location: Hyderabad
Org/Cloud: HPS (Hyperforce-platform-security)

Salary: 57,00,000
Bonus: Performance bonus up to 15% of base ~8.5L
Stock bonus: $145,000 (~1.2cr for 4 years, 30L per year)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 95.5 LPA

Note:
1. There is only a decent hike in my TC from this offer but comp wasn't my motivation for change. I spent my internship as well as all 5.5 YOE at the same company and I was looking for a change in work.
2. Salesforce in general doesn't offer this much RSUs. I think their cap is 74k USD for 4 years but I was able to negotiate since I have a lot of unvested stocks at my current company.

Interview experience: https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/6297389/Salesforce-or-SMTS-or-Hyderabad-or-Jan-2025-offer

title: Microsoft | Consultant | L56 | Fresher | Hyderabad
content:
**Years of Experience**: 0  
**Education**: B.E. in Computer Science Engineering from a Tier 3 College  
**Company**: Microsoft  
**Role/Level**: Consultant (L56)  
**Placement Type**: On-campus (Pool drive across multiple colleges)  
**Date of Offer**: October 2023 (4th Year of B.E.)  
**Joining Date**: May 2024  
**Location**: Hyderabad (Fixed)

### Compensation Details:

- **Signing Bonus**: ₹1,00,000 INR  
- **Base Pay**: ₹10,60,000 INR  
- **Relocation Bonus**: ₹3,00,000 INR (non-taxable) + ₹41,000 INR (one month basic pay)  
- **Stocks**: 4,000 USD (vested over 4 years)  
- **Performance Bonus**: 0-20% of base salary  

### Benefits:

- **Health and Hobby Reimbursement (Perks+)**: ₹30,000 INR  
- **Food Credits**: ₹200 per day  
- **Medical Insurance**: ₹5 Lakh employee + parents medical insurance (additional flex points available to increase this to ₹7 Lakh or convert them to Perks+)  
- **Transportation**: Buses and cabs to and from office  
- **Joining Kit and Goodies**: Year-end, participation, and team-specific rewards


In addition to the salary, both the employee and employer's contribution to the Provident Fund (PF) will be deducted from your monthly salary. Apart from this, you also receive a component called GP (Global Allowance), which is around ₹1,36,000 INR in your first salary. The entire tax for the year is deducted based on the tax regime (new or old) chosen, and the tax amount is approximately equivalent to the GP component of ₹1,36,000 INR. Therefore, you can consider that you won’t need to pay any tax in the first year, as the GP covers the entire tax amount. Please note that the GP component is not mentioned in the offer letter.

**In your first year, you also have the opportunity to visit Microsoft’s Seattle office for a 3-4 day event called "Accelerate", which is specially designed for new hires. This seven-day trip is fully reimbursed by Microsoft.**

*After accounting for PF and all other deductions, your take-home salary in the first year is approximately ₹78,000 INR per month.*

title: IBM Advisory Software Engineer (Band 8)
content:
I am working at **IBM** in Poland as an Advisory Software Engineer, and here is my total compensation:

26k ZT it's **6500k** USD per month or **78000k** USD a year (-33% taxes because I am older than 26 years old) = **4355** USD per month or **52260k** USD a year,
Also: 
* I have the ability to buy stock with a 15% discount twice a year, not more than 10% of my salary.
* I have medical insurance coverage (basic version for Poland if you have a resident card based on your contract with the company)

That's all.

title: IND Money | Senior Software Engineer | Gurgaon
content:
* Education: BTech Tier 1 Circuital Branch
* Years of Experience: 2.5
* Prior Experience: SDE 1 at a Startup
* Prev Comp: Around ₹24,00,000
* Date of the Offer: December 2024
* Company: Ind Money
* Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer
* Location: Gurgaon, India
* Salary: ₹30,00,000 (including retirals)
* Relocation: Nil
* Signing Bonus: Nil
* Stock bonus: ESOPs ₹10,00,000 lakh vested over 4 years (10, 20, 30, 40 % per year)
* Bonus: ₹3,00,000 variable pay based on performance paid quarterly (Eligible upto 200% based on quarterly ratings)
* Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): Around ₹33,00,000 (Excluded ESOPs as its paper money for now)
* Benefits: 18 paid leaves + 7 sick leaves + 6 casual leaves + 1 celebration leave + other standard benefits
* Other details:  They asked all the details beforehand, such as pay slips, aadhar card, bank statements, Original Offer Letter(current company) & Appointment letter/Agreement letter, offer in hand details as well as proofs, also last appraisal letter, which I found really weird as it was taking it too far. 
Even after all this, they did not match my current offer in hand, so rejected this one.

title: Amazon | DE1 | Bengaluru
content:
**Education:** B.Tech in Computer Science  
**Years of Experience:** 0 years  
**Internship Experience:** 6 months (Amazon, Data Engineer Intern)  
**Prior Experience:** Interned at Amazon  

**Offer Details:**  
- **Company:** Amazon  
- **Title/Level:** Data Engineer I  
- **Location:** Bengaluru, India  
- **Date of Offer:** January 2025  

### Compensation:  
- **Base Pay (INR):** ₹15,34,000  
- **Sign-on Bonus:**  
  - Year 1: ₹4,23,000  
  - Year 2: ₹3,81,000  
- **Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) Value (INR):** ₹10,93,000 (vested over 4 years)  
  - Vesting schedule:  
    - 5% after Year 1  
    - 15% after Year 2  
    - 20% every six months thereafter until fully vested  

- **Relocation (INR):** ₹1,50,000  

**Total Compensation (First Year):**  
Base Pay + Sign-on Bonus (Year 1) + RSUs (First Year Vesting)  
= ₹15,34,000 + ₹4,23,000 + ₹54,650 (5% of ₹10,93,000)  
= **₹20,11,650**  

**Total Compensation (4 Years):**  
Base Pay (4 years) + Sign-on Bonus (2 years) + Full RSU Value  
= ₹15,34,000 \xD7 4 + ₹4,23,000 + ₹3,81,000 + ₹10,93,000  
= **₹75,55,000**  

### Benefits:  
1. **Annual Leave:**  
   - 15 working days of annual leave per financial year  
   - 12 calendar days of sick leave per financial year  
   - 12 calendar days of casual leave per financial year  
   - 10 mandatory and optional holidays per calendar year  

2. **Transportation Allowance:**  
   - Tier 1 cities (Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Chennai, Mumbai, NCR, Kolkata): ₹4,000/month  
   - Other cities: ₹1,500/month  

3. **Home Internet Reimbursement:** Up to ₹1,250/month  
4. **Meal Card:** ₹1,100/month  
5. **Insurance:** Standard Amazon insurance benefits .

title: Augnito - Reality Check of the Company If you are joining
content:
- I have regret to join this company.
- they are playing with employee career.
- they don't have money currently.
- they have eliminated +60% backend team + some of from other team also.
- they have unreal expectation.
- they hired but later they know they don't have money
- management is not aware of the latest finances of the company
- even I have not received FNF till now.

title: Flipkart | SDE-2 | Bangalore
content:
Current - 18.60 (fixed) + 1.5 (Variable)
Company - Product based MNC
Graduation - 2021 batch, B.Tech from NIT (3 yrs exp)
Current Company is okayish in terms of learning. 

I got offer from Flipkart for SDE-2 Role.
Offer Details - 
Base - 28 LPA
Performance Bonus - 10% (fixed)
RSUs - 14L vested equally over 4 years
Other - 1L
Total - 35.5 L for 1st year

I am expecting promotion in march and expecting min 20% Hike, also year end bonus payout is scheduled for Feb month that will be around 3L if I will resign before Feb, I would lose that money. 

I have tried negotiating with flipkart HR but she is not increasing base, even I had asked for joining bonus to compensate my year end bonus, but again no luck. I am not sure, if flipkart is low balling and if it is worth switching or not?

Any suggestions would be appreciated? Is there any other company where interview process can be fast forwarded as I have only 1 month notice period?

title: Microsoft L64 Hyd v/s Small Services Company Retention offer
content:
YOE: 10+
Univ: tier-1.5 (basically top 10 but not an old IIT)
offers:
MICROSOFT-
offer date- Nov 2024
location: Hyderabad
base: 60Lpa (pf incl.)
perf: 15%(0-30)
level: L64
stocks: 180k US$/4yrs
reloc: 5.5L one-time
TC: ~1.05cr + MSFT benefits
misc:
NP - 45days


Small growing yet profitable Services Company, good clientele
base: 70L(revised from 60L) (pf incl)
perf: 12L(revised from 10L)
location: Remote
level: Sr. Staff Engg
TC: 82L, no employee benefits
misc:
NP - 3 months


MSFT BGV has been running for ages now, and I am mid-way my NP already, until my employer spoke about retaining me.
However, this is the last week I should get back to them If I am keen.


Dear LC Community, kindly guide me. If I don't accept the retention offer, there'd be no looking back onto my current employer. And w.r.t Microsoft, their BGV has had questions raised in the process so far about me having input wrong dates intentionally, and a gap I have to basically hide a 2mon long employment that didn't unfold well.


Dilemma- I'm 4mons old in current company, it is going great thence the retention. Furthermore, I haven't heard anything from MSFT BGV p.o.v despite 30days+ already and actually fear an offer rescind. That ways, if I don't accept the retention, I'll be the ultimate loser. And if I accept and MSFT unfolds on a good note thereafter, it'd be a catch 22 on my ethics.


HELP!

content:
Hello,
I had got the opportunity to interview at Porter for SDE 2 position for Bangalore office in Oct 2024. Got this opportunity from naukari (not applied directly).

**Previous experience:** 3.7 YOE in a young company.

**Round 1: Screening Round**
Asked about my current and preivous work experience, Insights into my technical knowledge of java, databases, microservices.

They wanted to check if i fit there technical and functional criterion.

**Round 2: DSA Round**
Two DSA questions

Q1. Group anagrams: https://leetcode.com/problems/group-anagrams/description/

Q2. Word Break: https://leetcode.com/problems/word-break/description/

Able to solve both within time.

**Round 3: Design Round**

In my experience they had asked one of the realistic question for LLD round, where the question was not a regular question and had involved critical thinking and design skills.

Implement this system,

Imagine we have an e-commerce product - a simpler version of the Amazon app.

Current customer flow:
Customers can search and select products.
* Products can be added to the cart.
* Once added to the cart, customers can check out the products. Order placed is visible in the app with the latest status. 
* Payment mode available is only offline after delivery.

Current backend systems:
* Catalog/Product Service: Manages the product life cycle, including creation and retrieval of products.
* Cart Service: Handles operations related to user carts, such as adding and removing items. Each user can have only one cart.
* Order Service: Manages order creation and updates status. It does not include a payment system, as payments are handled on delivery.

New Product Requirement:
* The product team wants to introduce a new feature - a Coupon system. 
* Initially, the system should support a single coupon:
	* A coupons tab will be visible in the checkout page in App which will show all the applicable coupons to the customer.
	* Introducing only a single coupon - 10% discount applied to the 11th order.
	* This coupon can only be used once per user, and it can be redeemed only once in a lifetime.
	* The coupon should be available to the user again if the transaction fails.

The type of coupon is not limited to just discount coupon. There could be other types as well. for ex
1. Get flat Rs 100 off on first order.
2. Get 10% discount on order above Rs 1000 
3. Avail cashback of 5% upto Rs 50 on the next order.
4. Get a 15% discount on SBI / HDFC / Any card.
5. Buy 2 get 1 for all the shirts of some type.

Basically there can be any type of coupon which can be applied on the cart if the conditions are satisifed (like first order)

Think about the system in generic manner.

My solution after lot of discussions and even after interview

```
I will create a new microservice like coupon-service just like a order service. This microservice will handle CRUD ops on coupons, validate coupon, apply coupon etc.

User journey
Cart Page > Checkout > List of Coupons  > Apply Coupon

Entities

1. class Coupon
		String couponId
		String code
		Enum type: USER_LEVEL / PRODUCT_LEVEL
		String description
		List<Condition> conditions
		List<Reward> rewards
		Date lastValiditiyDate
		Enum status: APPLIED, EXPIRED, AVAILABLE

2. class Condition
	String conditionId

	2.1 class OrderCondition extends Condition
		Integer noOfOrder

	2.2 class CartCondition extends Condition
		Integer cartValue

	2.3 class PaymentCondtion extends Condition
		Card card

	2.4 class ProductType extends Condition
		ProductType productType

3 class Reward
	String rewardId

	3.1 class DiscountReward extends Reward
		Integer discountPercent
		Optional<Integer> uptoLimit
		Enum type: FLAT / UPTO / ...

	3.2 class CashbackReward extends Reward
		Integer cashbackAmount
		Optional<Integer> uptoLimit

	3.3 class VoucherReward extends Reward
		Integer voucherId

Coupon Microservice will expose some APIs

1. CRUD APIs for Coupon
2. Get List of available coupons
	GET /coupons/list?cartId=?&userId=?
3. Apply coupon
	POST /coupons/apply
	Request Body: {
		String cartId
		String couponId
	}
	Response Body: 
	200 OK {
		String message;
		payload: {
			List<Reward> rewards
		}
	}
	400 Bad Request {
		String message
	}

```
Although the solution that i gave is still not generic and requires extension whenver any type of coupon or condition or reward comes in.

Plus, this too is a much refined solution and I thought about list of condition and rewards in coupons at the near end of interview after many hints.

Final Verdict: Rejected

Ps: If anyone have a solution (maybe better or less better) please comment, so that even i can get some more idea on it?

title: Juspay vs Branch International - Which one to choose ?
content:
Need Help
College - Tier3 (2025 Batch)
Got multiple offers but, 2 major:

1) SDE Intern + PPO at Juspay
* Intern 40k / month from Bangalore
* Need to leave my city 
* PPO is already confirmed for (Associate SDE i.e. SDE1) and is good enough

2) SDE Intern (ML) at Branch International
* Intern 51k / month completely remote 
* PPO is subject to performance and company's needs completely.
* PPO range not clearly communicated despite asking multiple times.

Which one to choose ? Key considerations:
* Career growth in the early years
* Learning + Tech Stack
* Compensation (obviously)

I was thinking to go with Juspay considering the organisation reputation, learning curve and everything but the only problem is internship stipend is not very competitive and I have to leave my hometown for it but the PPO is great.

please help !!

title: Zeta | SDE 2 | Hyderabad | 2024 (December)
content:
**Zeta | SDE 2**

**Recruiter said this is the max they can offer,** do anyone get better than below compensation ? 

Prior Experience: Product Based Company
YOE : 2 years 5 Months 
Date-OF-Offer : December 2024

Base : 26 L (including PF)
Joining Bonus : 2 L
Stocks : 6.5 L ( 10%, 20%, 30%, 40%)
Reallocation : upto 75k (Reimbursement) : hotels, flight etc.

**1st year : 26 L + 2 L + 65 K = 28.65 L INR.**
2nd year : 26 L + 1.3 L = 27.3 L INR [Assuming 0% increment]
3rd year : 26 L +  1.95 L = 27.95 L INR
4th year : 26 L + 2.6 L = 28.6 L INR.

--------------------------------------

**Other Perks (Per Year) :**
Gratuity : 62500 INR
Health Insurance : 42,500 INR
Life Insurance : 11083 INR

title: Career Discussion
content:
Hi everyone,

YOE: 5.5 approx (2019 Grad) 
Current Base: 24
Bonus: 5 approx
Stocks: 3 lacs per year (will change to 5 from next year b/c of refreshers) 
Total per year ~ 32

I have been working at my current company for around 2.5 years now. 
I'm not intrested in Learning anything new, I just want to get decent money for couple of more years and eventuallly retire or start something of my own (business/startup).

For this I see 2 options: 
1. I can switch my team with promotion but that will increase per year by ~15% only. And this will increase expectations from me.
2. Switch company and get a decent offer.

Anyone on the same boat?
What are you guys doing?

content:

	Base                : 37.25 L
	Variable(10%): 3.7 L
	RSU: 25L
	TOTAL ~ 65,00,000
Other benifits - 
	- Good work life balance
	- Great food and people
	- 2 days work from office
	- Rich culture
	- Glassdoor review 4.2 (great place to work certified)

title: Google | L4 | Blr [Accepted ]
content:
Education: BE ECE 
Years of Experience: 7 (2.5 Years in Service Based, remaining in MAANG)
Date of offer Accepted: 29'th Nov 

Timelines: 
1. Phone Screening : Sept Mid 
2. Technical Rounds: Nov 17- Nov 19 
3. GNL : Nov 22
4. Had two team fit calls, both successful. 
5. Nov 26'th HC. 
6. Nov 27'th Recruiter called with inital numbers, negotiated slighlty. Nov 29'th got the offer letter


TC: 81LPA (For first year) 
Base: 35L 
Target Bonus: 15% 
Stocks: 121K USD. 

Google has always been my dream and its my third attempt. When i was in a service based company, i applied serveral times, but each time i wasn't able to make it. 

When i was in the service based company they weren't even willing to give an interview. Feels good to finally make it. 
I am happy with L4 and I am okay to get promoted, as i love the team i am joining. Wish me luck guys !!

title: TomTom Internship Expirience
content: The Internship  selection process involved shortlisting students based on CGPA, followed by interviews that tested my knowledge in SQL, Java, C++, and DSA. I began my six-month internship in June, which continued until December. During the internship, I had the opportunity to work on a cutting-edge technology stack, including Java, Spring, and Azure,Apache Spark,Apache Airflow,Python.\n\nI\u2019m thrilled to share that after successfully completing the internship, I\u2019ve been offered the position of Software Engineer 1 at TomTom with a total CTC of 16 LPA, comprising a base salary of 14 LPA, with no stocks or signing bonus. Grateful for this incredible journey and looking forward to the opportunities ahead!

title: Mindbody | Urgent | Salary expectations | SDE-2
content:
Query:
I am currently interviewing with Mindbody and would like to understand what I can expect in terms of CTC and the fixed component.
	•	Experience (YEO): 4.5+ years
	•	Current CTC: ₹30 LPA
	•	Current Company: Product-based

So far, I have received strong hire feedback in my interviews. I will share my complete interview experience once the process is finalized.

Given that Mindbody is planning an IPO in the next 12 to 18 months, will this provide any additional benefits in terms of compensation or stock options?

Thanks

Update - Got an offer of 37 base + 3L joining bonus + 5.5% yearly bonus (depends on SDE level)

I had to nigotiate a lot on this as their band for sde2 is below the provided offer, I offered myself for other interview for sde-3 but they disagree and it was final offer which was given. I served my complete 2 months of notice period before joining joining them in 15 to 20 days can give you better joining bonus but I wanted to serve mine to explore more opportunity .

title: URGENT HELP NEEDED ON - Qualcomm vs Current Job (WFH)
content:
YOE: 4.4.
CCTC: 22 LPA.
Company: Working in a Service based for last 2 years.
Current work mode: Permanent WFH.

Received this offer from Qualcomm:-
Gross Salary + Retirals - INR 27 L
Joining RSU - 15k USD
Performance RSU - 9.75k USD
Performance Bonus - 1.87 Lakh
Locations - Bangalore, India.

HR is very strict on Negotiations. HR informed me about the numbers before proceeding with the application. I tried to negotiate post the offer but there are no scope for negotiations.

I'm pretty comfortable working from home which gives me lots of flexibility in work. But at the same point of time, I want to work in more impactful project in a reputed company which will definitely improve my resume. 

Considering the current job market where resume getting shortlisted itself a challenge & big task, it's very crucial to work on projects with more impact and that's the reason I interviewed at Qualcomm. But the compensation they offered is not ideal and since there won't be any gain in-hand considering all the expenses at Bangalore and there are uncertainty about the work culture too at Qualcomm.

I'm in complete dilema and need your help. 

**PLEASE provide your valuable suggestions & upvote, so that it reaches the maximum audiences who can help me !!**

title: Updated - [HELP] Multiple offers | Agoda | Servicenow | Salesforce
content:
Current Compensation: 26 LPA
Work: Senior Consultant (VueJs, GraphQL, AWS)
Tier-3 College
Location: Bangalore
Experience: 8 years

Offer 1: Agoda
Compensation:160KTHB
Work: Fullstack (80% Frontend - ReactJs)

Offer 2: Servicenow
Compensation: 47.5LPA(32.5LPA base + 10% performance + 45.5K USD stocks)
Work: Senior UI Engineer (vanillaJs + internal servicenow platform like reactJs)

Offer 3: Salesforce
Compensation: First year 52LPA(34 LPA base + 10% performance + 53.5 USD stocks + 3L joining bonus)
Second year 49LPA
Work: MTS backend work in Java.

As per the work I was interested more in Agoda tech stack, but they want me to relocate to Bangkok which I cannot because of personal reasons. I am confused now which company should I join considering Servicenow tool will be internal which might not add that value to my resume and Salesforce is more backend oriented which is more like changing my domain.

Please suggest what would be better here. Thanks in advance.


Update: After multiple negotiations Salesforce was ready to give SMTS
Compensation: 75LPA(53 LPA base + 15% performance + (~65K USD))

Thank you for all your help.

title: Need advice | Linkedin SWE vs Stripe L2 vs Uber SE2 - Bangalore
content:
Current TC - 27 LPA
YOE - 3.9

Linkedin - 35 LPA (base) + 3.5 LPA (bonus) + 75K Stocks for 4 years
Stripe - Verbal Confirmation, no numbers yet. (expected comp - 40L Base, 10L JB, 28L Equity)
Uber - HM round remaining.

I believe the final offers/numbers would be similar to what has been offered in past to other folks.

Linkedin Team - Systems Infrastructure 
Stripe Team- Finance and Revenue Automation
Uber Team - Don't know yet

Can I get comments on -
1. What kind of work is in these teams?
2. What should I choose?
3. What is the scope of negotiation?

My priorities: Job Security > Learning = Compensation > WLB

Please provide your valuable comments on the basis of Hikes, Promotions, Job Security, WLB.

-------------------------------------
Linkedin Interview experience
-------------

1. Recruiter Screening - data collection
2. TPS (screening) - elimination round - 2 DSA questions of medium level on Tree - Some current work related questions
3. On site 1 - Coding - 2 medium DSA Questions - 1 DP, 1 Graph (bipartite graph)
4. On site 2 - Coding - 1 Medium, 1 Hard DSA - Merging 2 n-ary tree on basis of some condition, and the other one was of DP
5. On Site 3 - System Design - Mix of HLD and LLD - design a observability system
6. On Site 4 - HM - lot of tricky questions and in depth questions on resume.

- Support for education assistance and adoption reimbursement

content:
Recently interviewed with Paypal and recieved an offer for T23/SDE-2 position. Please help me evaluate whether I should join or wait for a better opportunity in January or February.

Years of Experience: 3.5

**Current Compensation **- 
Current Org : Product based Indian Startup
Base: 25 LPA
Bonus: 2 LPA
CTC: (25 + 2) ~ 27 LPA

**Paypal Offer - **
Base: 22 LPA
Bonus: 10%
RSU / Stock Grant:  $22K / 3 Years ~ 6 LPA
Signing + Relocation : 0 (Will have to relocate out of my own pocket)
CTC: (22 + 2.2 + 6) ~ 30 LPA

I left my last org in September, so since October I have been preparing and interviewing. Will it look bad on my resume if I choose to wait till January/February as it will be a gap of 4-5 months.

I am confused because I had a lot better offers with some startups and this feels like a let down. I rejected them as I wanted a brand on my resume. 
Should I accept the offer or wait till Jan/Feb when other organisations start hiring?
Please let me know your views.

title: Paypal | SDE-2 | Bangalore
content:
Recently interviewed with Paypal and recieved an offer for T23/SDE-2 position. Please help me evaluate whether I should join or wait for a better opportunity in January or February.

Years of Experience: 3.5

**Current Compensation **- 
Current Org : Product based Indian Startup
Base: 25 LPA
Bonus: 2 LPA
CTC: (25 + 2) ~ 27 LPA

**Paypal Offer - **
Base: 22 LPA
Bonus: 10%
RSU / Stock Grant:  $22K / 3 Years ~ 6 LPA
Signing + Relocation : 0 (Will have to relocate out of my own pocket)
CTC: (22 + 2.2 + 6) ~ 30 LPA

I left my last org in September, so since October I have been preparing and interviewing. Will it look bad on my resume if I choose to wait till January/February as it will be a gap of 4-5 months.

I am confused because I had a lot better offers with some startups and this feels like a let down. I rejected them as I wanted a brand on my resume. 
Should I accept the offer or wait till Jan/Feb when other organisations start hiring?
Please let me know your views.

title: Google | L4 | November 2024 | Bangalore
content:
Education: Dual degree - Math and Computer Science (IIT)
Years of Experience :
At the time when recruiter reached out : 2 yr (July end)
At the time of interview : 2 yr 2 month (Aug , Sept)
At the time of offer : 2 yr  3 month (Nov)

plus(+) Intern Experience 6 month + 2 month [ Not considered as experience in any steps]

Current company : Some Retails Giant 
Current Compensation:
At the time when recruiter reached out (Sde1): 22 Base + 10% bonus = 24.2LPA
At the time of offer  : [Got promoted during the rounds to sde2 ] = 25LPA Base + 5 lac annual bonus = 30LPA  

Date of the Offer: November 2024
Company: Google
Level: L4
Location: Bangalore
Round : 
Base : 35 lacs
Retirals: ~3 lacs (pf + gratuity)
Signing Bonus: 8 lacs
Relocation Bonus : ~5 lacs
Stock bonus: $99k (38%,32%,20%,10%) -> 83.5 Lacs : 1st yr -> 31.73 lacs
Target bonus: 15% -> (5.2 lacs)
Total comp for 1st year(Salary + Stock + Retirals + Signing + relocation + annual bonus): 87.93 LPA

Total comp for 2nd yr : ~70 LPA

Note : Few important points :
1. I had to negotiate with my recruiter to interview for an L4 role, initially the recruiter didn't agree, but I asked her to keep it open and based on my interview please try to push for a L4 role, as my years of experience was qualified for a L4 role in theory. In a lot of cases recruiter for L3 and L4 are different, then it might be tough to negotiate.

2. The recruiter was good, she clearly said : If and only if I get hire and strong hire in every rounds + if the team I get a match with shares some Letter of Recommendation for L4 role,  only then there is a chance for approval of L4 role from Hiring Committee.

3. My rounds were : 
	* Screening : H [Not counted for evauation]
	* 1st Round : H [Few remarks : unconventional but correct solution]
	* 2nd Round : SH 
	* 3rd Round : SH 
	* Googlyness : H

Matched with the first team, the Director did thoroughly scrutinised my design skills , work I did in current company and things on my resume and later the recruiter said that he will share the LOR for L4. 

Offer Status : Accepted

Please subscribe to my youtube channel :
[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1VLjyUYf43ub7sYUr65S8w
)
I will start sharing some in depths content on :
* Resume that got me through : Uber  , Tiktok (Singapore) , Cred , Zepto , Google and lots of other MNC's and startups.
* Preparation Strategy : From Scratch to Software Engineer 2 (L4)
* Google Specific Prepation Strategy
* Backend Engineering : More and more about less and less -> Starting from what is  internet, which I see a lot of people working in backend and frontend don't know.
* How to negotiate for some good joining bonus etc.

I mentor a lot of people from college, current company and other levels personally, still planning on all of these stuffs, I have some personal commitments and bandwidth crunch, if I see some good resposne on the youtube channel,  I will definitely try to spend some time on these contents as well.

Meanwhile , I will keep posting on Leetcode , as and when I get some time. 

Thank you.

title: Salesforce MTS Offer
content:
Education: B.Tech CS in Tier-2 College
Years of Experience: 2.4 years
Prior Experience: SDE 1 at Saas startup
Date of the Offer: Oct 2024
Company: Salesforce (Service cloud)
Role : Backend developer
Previous techstack : Java spring boot
Title: MTS (Member of technical staff)
Location: Bangalore (flexible according to team, no rigid rules like come to office 3 times a week)
Salary/Base: ₹32,00,000
Bonus: ₹3,20,000 (10% of base)
Stock Bonus: $50,000 for 4 years (equally vested)
Total Comp: ₹45,70,000
Previous CTC: ₹24,00,000 (₹20,00,000 Base + ₹4,00,000 ESOPs per year)
Benefits: Standard salesforce benifits 
LC/CP states : around 850 questions on LC, 500 on CF (used to do in college), knight in lc , CF max rating specialist, 4 star on CC. Haven't solved much in atcoder.
Preparation strategy: 
Algorithms : 
    Used to solve leetcode regularly in year starting and gave contests to keep my coding skills sharp. When my interviews got scheduled I just went through some standard medium/Hard problems. For most of the companies doing leetcode is enough. But please do questions in depth rathar than doing it for increasing the count of questions. Please give contests on LC. Always try to attempt harder questions than your current level. 
System design : 
     For LLD I have gone through online blogs and youTube but mainly I frame my answers according to my learnings till now. Ideally at 2+ years exp you are already aware of most of the basics of LLD so go through the basics of LLD and then apply your day to day Dev skills to frame the answer (please refer some standard questions online and then frame the answer that way). 
	 For HLD you can follow CodeKarle youTube channel, that covers all the basics of hld and he has covered all the standard questions. You can watch those and form your solutions according to that because any question can be answered using basics of hld and standard questions that are already available on youtube.

One more important note please give some mock interviews for algorithms and system design both and do not take hr round very lightly, please prepare for behavioural questions seriously before your hr/hm round. 

How Did I apply : I applied thourgh referral, one of college seniors referred me in August end.
Other companies that I interviewed with : Zepto and got a call from Goldman for associate but my joining date was already very near by that time. Got ghosted by Zepto after two rounds. 

Accepted the offer as I am getting very good hike according to my current TC(and good tag on resume) and didn't get to interview with any other company which can beat this TC. My only concern is if sf has good work or not (have read some online reviews that work is not that good here). Will add interview exp in future.

title: Is only DSA enough for 4-5 YOE? Sorry for posting here :P
content:
I’m asking this on behalf of a friend. He’s from a Tier-1 college and has 4.5 years of experience. He’s worked at a couple of good product-based companies and is now looking for a switch.

The problem is, while he’s amazing at DSA, that’s pretty much where it ends. His work so far has mostly been on legacy products, which involved a lot of bug-fixing but no real opportunities to build anything or work on modern frameworks. He only knows C++ and some basic Java, and he’s never done any proper development work.

He’s really scared right now and feels like he’s wasted these 4.5 years in a chill environment that didn’t challenge him enough. He’s worried that no good company will hire him due to lack of proper development experience.

Any advice for someone in his situation? Also, if he does manage to crack an interview, what kind of CTC can he realistically expect? His current CTC is 28 LPA (26 base).

title: Hey Coach claiming to place me with 70 LPA to 1 CPA CTC
content:
Hey Folks, 

I am preparing for interviews and solving DSA, learning about System Design etc. I have been able to crack companies paying me 42 LPA CTC (35 as base). I have around 4 years of experience. 

I got a call from Hey Coach. They are gonna charge 1.6 lakhs (EMI option available too) and enrol me in their interview preparation batch. They will train me on DSA, System Design, Resume building etc and claim to get me placed in companies like MAANG, Paypal with more than 70 LPA. He also claimed that he will try to refer me to the companies paying 65-70 as base and my overall CTC will be more than 1 CR. 

The course timeline will be 4 months. Is it worth going for? I know it is, if they are actually true in what they are claiming. I just wanted to know if someone or someone you guys know has got this much compensation via Hey Coach. Please help me out here. 

I am preparing for the interviews and my goal was to join a stable company paying me around 45 LPA as base. I have already reached till 35. But now I am being greedy lol.

title: IG Groups | Graduate Engineer Trainee, 2024 | Bengaluru, India
content:
Education: BE in Computer Science (Tier 3 College)
Years of Experience: 0
Prior Experience: None
Date of the Offer: October 2023
Company: **IG Groups**
Title/Level: Graduate Engineer Trainee
Location: Bengaluru, India
Salary: ₹10,35,575 (CTC)
Relocation: 0
Signing Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: 0
Total comp : ₹10,35,575
Work Type: Hybrid (2 days Work from office Compulsary)
Benefits: 15 days of Annual Leave per year + Standard Indian Holiday (Government Holidays) + 7 days Sick Leave + 5 days Causual Leave + Leave on birthday + 4 weeks Work from any where


--- CTC Breakdown (₹10,35,575) ---
Gross Salary = ₹9,00,000
Medical Insurance Premium = ₹14,000 (₹1,167 per month)
EPF - Employer = ₹64,800 (₹5,400 per month)
Gratuity = ₹17,175 (₹1,431 per month)
Gym Expenses = ₹18,000 (₹1,500 per month)
Internet Expenses = ₹21,600 (₹1,800 per month)
**Total = 10,35,575 + Bonus (Based on Company performance)**
Bonus (not included in CTC) : ₹25,000 to ₹50,000 Christmas Bonus (same for all the employees of company) + 1,00,000 to 2,00,000 Performance Bonus (depends on individual)

--- Gross Salary Breakdown (₹9,00,000) ---
Gross Salary (per month) = ₹75,000
Allowance (per month) = ₹6,300 (₹1,600 Conveyance + ₹2,200 Food Vouchers + ₹1,250 Medical reimbursement + ₹1,250 Leave Travel Allowances)
Gross - Allowance (per month) = **₹68,700** (₹2,200 Food Vouchers can be liquidified)
